title.narrative: 2.1 LEARNING FOR CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: Children and adolescents have access to improved opportunities for learning, including life skills and citizenship education, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, More girls and boys, including adolescents and the most vulnerable, benefitting from multiple pathways to quality learning, including life skills development and citizenship education, and protection

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents have access to improved opportunities for learning, including life skills and citizenship education

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic significantly marked the education sector in 2020, with the early end of the school year in March 2020 and back to school at 50% of the school capacity in September 2020. Despite these challenges, UNICEF has supported key results, including the continuity of the education curriculum reform for grade 1 and 2; and addressing the COVID-19 context through progressive establishment of blended learning opportunities and adapted curricula from grade 1 to 12,;adjusting to the presence of children in school on rotation for;the 2020-2021 school year. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:29/12/2020
